   19: %%
   20: %%% Purpose : Test the timer module a simpler/faster test than timer_SUITE
   21: 
   22: -module(timer_simple_SUITE).
   23: 
   24: %% This test suite matches on opaque tref() return values from the *_after
   25: %% and *_interval functions, namely {instant, _}, {send_local, _}, {once, _}
   26: %% and {interval, _}.
   27: %% If the implementation changes, the test suite has to be changed accordingly.
   28: 
   29: %% external
   30: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   31:          init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2, 
   32:          init_per_testcase/2,
   33:          apply_after1/1,
   34:          apply_after2/1,
   35:          apply_after3/1,
   36:          apply_after4/1,
   37:          apply_after_invalid_args/1,
   38:          send_after1/1,
   39:          send_after2/1,
   40:          send_after3/1,
   41:          send_after4/1,
   42:          send_after5/1,
   43:          send_after6/1,
   44:          send_after7/1,
   45:          send_after_invalid_args/1,
   46:          exit_after1/1,
   47:          exit_after2/1,
   48:          exit_after3/1,
   49:          exit_after4/1,
   50:          kill_after1/1,
   51:          kill_after2/1,
   52:          kill_after3/1,
   53:          apply_interval1/1,
   54:          apply_interval2/1,
   55:          apply_interval_invalid_args/1,
   56:          apply_repeatedly1/1,
   57:          apply_repeatedly2/1,
   58:          apply_repeatedly_invalid_args/1,
   59:          send_interval1/1,
   60:          send_interval2/1,
   61:          send_interval3/1,
   62:          send_interval4/1,
   63:          send_interval5/1,
   64:          send_interval_invalid_args/1,
   65:          cancel1/1,
   66:          cancel2/1,
   67:          cancel3/1,
   68:          cancel4/1,
   69:          cancel5/1,
   70:          cancel6/1,
   71:          cancel_invalid_args/1,
   72:          sleep1/1,
   73:          sleep2/1,
   74:          tc/1,
   75:          unexpected1/1,
   76:          unexpected2/1,
   77:          unexpected3/1,
   78:          nonexistent1/1,
   79:          nonexistent2/1,
   80:          timer_perf/1]).
   81: 
   82: %% internal
   83: -export([forever/0,
   84:          do_nrev/2,
   85:          send/2,
   86:          timer/4,
   87:          timer/5]).
   88: 
   89: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   90: 
   91: suite() ->
   92:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   93:      {timetrap,{minutes,10}}].
   94: 
   95: all() ->
   96:     [
   97:         {group, apply_after},
   98:         {group, send_after},
   99:         {group, exit_after},
  100:         {group, kill_after},
  101:         {group, apply_interval},
  102:         {group, apply_repeatedly},
  103:         {group, send_interval},
  104:         {group, cancel},
  105:         {group, sleep},
  106:         {group, misc}
  107:     ].
  108: 
  109: groups() -> 
  110:     [
  111:         {
  112:             apply_after,
  113:             [],
  114:             [
  115:                 apply_after1,
  116:                 apply_after2,
  117:                 apply_after3,
  118:                 apply_after4,
  119:                 apply_after_invalid_args
  120:             ]
  121:         },
  122:         {
  123:             send_after,
  124:             [],
  125:             [
  126:                 send_after1,
  127:                 send_after2,
  128:                 send_after3,
  129:                 send_after4,
  130:                 send_after5,
  131:                 send_after6,
  132:                 send_after7,
  133:                 send_after_invalid_args
  134:             ]
  135:         },
  136:         {
  137:             exit_after,
  138:             [],
  139:             [
  140:                 exit_after1,
  141:                 exit_after2,
  142:                 exit_after3,
  143:                 exit_after4
  144:             ]
  145:         },
  146:         {
  147:             kill_after,
  148:             [],
  149:             [
  150:                 kill_after1,
  151:                 kill_after2,
  152:                 kill_after3
  153:             ]
  154:         },
  155:         {
  156:             apply_interval,
  157:             [],
  158:             [
  159:                 apply_interval1,
  160:                 apply_interval2,
  161:                 apply_interval_invalid_args
  162:             ]
  163:         },
  164:         {
  165:             apply_repeatedly,
  166:             [],
  167:             [
  168:                 apply_repeatedly1,
  169:                 apply_repeatedly2,
  170:                 apply_repeatedly_invalid_args
  171:             ]
  172:         },
  173:         {
  174:             send_interval,
  175:             [],
  176:             [
  177:                 send_interval1,
  178:                 send_interval2,
  179:                 send_interval3,
  180:                 send_interval4,
  181:                 send_interval5,
  182:                 send_interval_invalid_args
  183:             ]
  184:         },
  185:         {
  186:             cancel,
  187:             [],
  188:             [
  189:                 cancel1,
  190:                 cancel2,
  191:                 cancel3,
  192:                 cancel4,
  193:                 cancel5,
  194:                 cancel6,
  195:                 cancel_invalid_args
  196:             ]
  197:         },
  198:         {
  199:             sleep,
  200:             [],
  201:             [
  202:                 sleep1,
  203:                 sleep2
  204:             ]
  205:         },
  206:         {
  207:             misc,
  208:             [],
  209:             [
  210:                 tc,
  211:                 unexpected1,
  212:                 unexpected2,
  213:                 unexpected3,
  214:                 nonexistent1,
  215:                 nonexistent2,
  216:                 timer_perf
  217:             ]
  218:         }
  219:     ].
  220: 
  221: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  222:     Config.
  223: 
  224: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  225:     ok.
  226: 
  227: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  228:     Config.
  229: 
  230: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  231:     Config.
  232: 
  233: 
  234: init_per_testcase(_, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  235:     ok = timer:start(),
  236:     Config.
  237: 
  238: %% Testing timer interface!!
  239: 
  240: %% Test of apply_after with time = 0, with sending of message.
  241: apply_after1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  242:     Msg = make_ref(),
  243:     {ok, {instant, _}} = timer:apply_after(0, ?MODULE, send, [self(), {Msg, 1}]),
  244:     {ok, {instant, _}} = timer:apply_after(0, fun erlang:send/2, [self(), {Msg, 2}]),
  245:     Self = self(),
  246:     {ok, {instant, _}} = timer:apply_after(0, fun() -> Self ! {Msg, 3} end),
  247:     ok = get_messes(1000, Msg, [1, 2, 3]).
  248: 
  249: %% Test of apply_after with time = 500, with sending of message.
  250: apply_after2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  251:     Msg = make_ref(),
  252:     {ok, {once, _}} = timer:apply_after(500, ?MODULE, send, [self(), {Msg, 1}]),
  253:     {ok, {once, _}} = timer:apply_after(500, fun erlang:send/2, [self(), {Msg, 2}]),
  254:     Self = self(),
  255:     {ok, {once, _}} = timer:apply_after(500, fun() -> Self ! {Msg, 3} end),
  256:     ok = get_messes(1000, Msg, [1, 2, 3]).
  257: 
  258: %% Test that a request starts the timer server if it is not running.
  259: apply_after3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  260:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(kernel_sup, timer_server),
  261:     Msg = make_ref(),
  262:     timer:apply_after(100, erlang, send, [self(), Msg]),
  263:     ok = get_mess(500, Msg),
  264:     {timer_server, Pid, worker, [timer]} = lists:keyfind(timer_server, 1, supervisor:which_children(kernel_sup)),
  265:     true = is_pid(Pid).
  266: 
  267: %% Test that a request starts the timer server if it is not running.
  268: apply_after4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  269:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(kernel_sup, timer_server),
  270:     ok = supervisor:delete_child(kernel_sup, timer_server),
  271:     Msg = make_ref(),
  272:     timer:apply_after(100, erlang, send, [self(), Msg]),
  273:     ok = get_mess(500, Msg),
  274:     {timer_server, Pid, worker, [timer]} = lists:keyfind(timer_server, 1, supervisor:which_children(kernel_sup)),
  275:     true = is_pid(Pid).
  276: 
  277: %% Test that apply_after rejects invalid arguments.
  278: apply_after_invalid_args(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  279:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_after(-1, fun() -> ok end),
  280:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_after(0, foo),
  281:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_after(0, fun(_X) -> ok end),
  282:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_after(-1, fun(_X) -> ok end, [foo]),
  283:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_after(0, foo, []),
  284:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_after(0, fun(_X) -> ok end, []),
  285:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_after(0, fun(_X) -> ok end, [foo, bar]),
  286:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_after(0, fun(_X) -> ok end, foo),
  287:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_after(-1, foo, bar, []),
  288:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_after(0, "foo", bar, []),
  289:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_after(0, foo, "bar", []),
  290:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_after(0, foo, bar, baz),
  291:     ok.
  292: 
  293: %% Test of send_after with time = 0.
  294: send_after1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  295:     Msg = make_ref(),
  296:     {ok, {instant, _}} = timer:send_after(0, Msg),
  297:     ok = get_mess(1000, Msg).
  298: 
  299: %% Test of send_after with time = 0 using a registered name.
  300: send_after2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  301:     Msg = make_ref(),
  302:     Name = register_name(self()),
  303:     {ok, {instant, _}} = timer:send_after(0, Name, Msg),
  304:     ok = get_mess(1000, Msg),
  305:     unregister(Name).
  306: 
  307: %% Test of send_after with time = 0 using a registered name
  308: %% and node.
  309: send_after3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  310:     Msg = make_ref(),
  311:     Name = register_name(self()),
  312:     {ok, {instant, _}} = timer:send_after(0, {Name, node()}, Msg),
  313:     ok = get_mess(1000, Msg),
  314:     unregister(Name).
  315: 
  316: %% Test of send_after with time = 500.
  317: send_after4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  318:     Msg = make_ref(),
  319:     {ok, {send_local, _}} = timer:send_after(500, self(), Msg),
  320:     ok = get_mess(2000, Msg).
  321: 
  322: %% Test of send_after with time = 500, with receiver a registered
  323: %% process. [OTP-2735]
  324: send_after5(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  325:     Msg = make_ref(),
  326:     Name = register_name(self()),
  327:     {ok, {once, _}} = timer:send_after(500, Name, Msg),
  328:     ok = get_mess(2000, Msg),
  329:     unregister(Name).
  330: 
  331: %% Test of send_after with time = 500 using a registered process
  332: %% and node.
  333: send_after6(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  334:     Msg = make_ref(),
  335:     Name = register_name(self()),
  336:     {ok, {once, _}} = timer:send_after(500, {Name, node()}, Msg),
  337:     ok = get_mess(2000, Msg),
  338:     unregister(Name).
  339: 
  340: %% Test that send_after works if the destination is a registered
  341: %% name which gets registered after the timer is started.
  342: send_after7(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  343:     Msg = make_ref(),
  344:     Name = make_name(),
  345:     {ok, {once, _}} = timer:send_after(500, Name, Msg),
  346:     register(Name, self()),
  347:     ok = get_mess(2000, Msg),
  348:     unregister(Name).
  349: 
  350: %% Test that send_after rejects invalid arguments.
  351: send_after_invalid_args(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  352:     {error, badarg} = timer:send_after(-1, test),
  353:     {error, badarg} = timer:send_after(-1, self(), test),
  354:     {error, badarg} = timer:send_after(-1, ?MODULE, test),
  355:     {error, badarg} = timer:send_after(0, "", test),
  356:     ok.
  357: 
  358: %% Test of exit_after with time = 1000.
  359: exit_after1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  360:     Msg = make_ref(),
  361:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  362:     Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, forever, []),
  363:     {ok, {once, _}} = timer:exit_after(1000, Pid, Msg),
  364:     ok = get_mess(5000, {'EXIT', Pid, Msg}).
  365: 
  366: %% Test of exit_after with time = 1000. The process to exit is the
  367: %% name of a registered process.  [OTP-2735]
  368: exit_after2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  369:     Msg = make_ref(),
  370:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  371:     Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, forever, []),
  372:     Name = register_name(Pid),
  373:     {ok, {once, _}} = timer:exit_after(1000, Name, Msg),
  374:     ok = get_mess(2000, {'EXIT', Pid, Msg}).
  375: 
  376: %% Test of exit_after for sending an exit to self.
  377: exit_after3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  378:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  379:     Msg = make_ref(),
  380:     Pid = spawn_link(
  381:         fun () ->
  382:             {ok, {once, _}} = timer:exit_after(1000, Msg),
  383:             forever()
  384:         end
  385:     ),
  386:     ok = get_mess(2000, {'EXIT', Pid, Msg}).
  387: 
  388: %% Test that using exit_after to a non-existent
  389: %% process does not crash the timer server.
  390: exit_after4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  391:     Mon = monitor(process, timer_server),
  392:     timer:exit_after(0, make_name(), make_ref()),
  393:     receive
  394:         {'DOWN', Mon, process, _, _} ->
  395:             error(timer_server_crashed)
  396:     after 1000 ->
  397:         ok
  398:     end.
  399: 
  400: %% Test of kill_after with time = 1000.
  401: kill_after1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  402:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  403:     Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, forever, []),
  404:     {ok, {once, _}} = timer:kill_after(1000, Pid),
  405:     ok = get_mess(2000, {'EXIT', Pid, killed}).
  406: 
  407: %% Test of kill_after with time = 1000. The process to exit is the
  408: %% name of a registered process.  [OTP-2735]
  409: kill_after2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  410:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  411:     Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, forever, []),
  412:     Name = register_name(Pid),
  413:     {ok, {once, _}} = timer:kill_after(1000, Name),
  414:     ok = get_mess(2000, {'EXIT', Pid, killed}).
  415: 
  416: %% Test of kill_after for self-killing.
  417: kill_after3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  418:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  419:     Pid = spawn_link(
  420:         fun () ->
  421:             {ok, {once, _}} = timer:kill_after(1000),
  422:             forever()
  423:         end
  424:     ),
  425:     ok = get_mess(2000, {'EXIT', Pid, killed}).
  426: 
  427: %% Test of apply_interval by sending messages. Receive
  428: %% 3 messages, cancel the timer, and check that we do
  429: %% not get any more messages.
  430: apply_interval1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  431:     Msg = make_ref(),
  432:     {ok, Ref1} = timer:apply_interval(1000, ?MODULE, send,
  433:                                       [self(), {Msg, 1}]),
  434:     {ok, Ref2} = timer:apply_interval(1000, fun erlang:send/2,
  435: 				      [self(), {Msg, 2}]),
  436:     Self = self(),
  437:     {ok, Ref3} = timer:apply_interval(1000, fun() -> Self ! {Msg, 3} end),
  438:     ok = get_messes(1500, Msg, [1, 2, 3], 3),
  439:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref1),
  440:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref2),
  441:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref3),
  442:     nor = get_messes(1000, Msg, [1, 2, 3]).
  443: 
  444: %% Test apply_interval with the execution time of the action
  445: %% longer than the timer interval. The timer should not wait for
  446: %% the action to complete, ie start another action while the
  447: %% previously started action is still running.
  448: apply_interval2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  449:     Msg = make_ref(),
  450:     Fn = fun(P, Idx) ->
  451:              P ! {Msg, Idx},
  452: 	    receive after 1000 -> ok end
  453:          end,
  454:     {ok, Ref1} = timer:apply_interval(500, erlang, apply,
  455:                                      [Fn, [self(), 1]]),
  456:     {ok, Ref2} = timer:apply_interval(500, Fn, [self(), 2]),
  457:     Self = self(),
  458:     {ok, Ref3} = timer:apply_interval(500, fun() -> Fn(Self, 3) end),
  459:     receive after 1800 -> ok end,
  460:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref1),
  461:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref2),
  462:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref3),
  463:     ok = get_messes(1000, Msg, [1, 2, 3], 3),
  464:     nor = get_messes(1000, Msg, [1, 2, 3]).
  465: 
  466: %% Test that apply_interval rejects invalid arguments.
  467: apply_interval_invalid_args(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  468:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_interval(-1, fun() -> ok end),
  469:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_interval(0, foo),
  470:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_interval(0, fun(_X) -> ok end),
  471:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_interval(-1, fun(_X) -> ok end, [foo]),
  472:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_interval(0, foo, []),
  473:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_interval(0, fun(_X) -> ok end, []),
  474:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_interval(0, fun(_X) -> ok end, [foo, bar]),
  475:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_interval(0, fun(_X) -> ok end, foo),
  476:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_interval(-1, foo, bar, []),
  477:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_interval(0, "foo", bar, []),
  478:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_interval(0, foo, "bar", []),
  479:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_interval(0, foo, bar, baz),
  480:     ok.
  481: 
  482: %% Test of apply_repeatedly by sending messages. Receive
  483: %% 3 messages, cancel the timer, and check that we do
  484: %% not get any more messages. In a case like this, ie where
  485: %% the execution time of the action is shorter than the timer
  486: %% interval, this should behave the same as apply_interval.
  487: apply_repeatedly1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  488:     Msg = make_ref(),
  489:     {ok, Ref1} = timer:apply_repeatedly(1000, ?MODULE, send,
  490:                                         [self(), {Msg, 1}]),
  491:     {ok, Ref2} = timer:apply_repeatedly(1000, fun erlang:send/2,
  492:                                         [self(), {Msg, 2}]),
  493:     Self = self(),
  494:     {ok, Ref3} = timer:apply_repeatedly(1000, fun() -> Self ! {Msg, 3} end),
  495:     ok = get_messes(1500, Msg, [1, 2, 3], 3),
  496:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref1),
  497:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref2),
  498:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref3),
  499:     nor = get_messes(1000, Msg, [1, 2, 3]).
  500: 
  501: %% Test apply_repeatedly with the execution time of the action
  502: %% longer than the timer interval. The timer should wait for
  503: %% the action to complete, ie not start another action until it
  504: %% has completed.
  505: apply_repeatedly2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  506:     Msg = make_ref(),
  507:     Fn = fun(P, I) ->
  508:              P ! {Msg, I},
  509:              receive after 1000 -> ok end
  510:          end,
  511:     Self = self(),
  512:     {ok, Ref1} = timer:apply_repeatedly(1, erlang, apply,
  513:                                         [Fn, [self(), 1]]),
  514:     {ok, Ref2} = timer:apply_repeatedly(1, Fn, [self(), 2]),
  515:     Self = self(),
  516:     {ok, Ref3} = timer:apply_repeatedly(1, fun() -> Fn(Self, 3) end),
  517:     receive after 2500 -> ok end,
  518:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref1),
  519:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref2),
  520:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref3),
  521:     ok = get_messes(1000, Msg, [1, 2, 3], 3),
  522:     nor = get_messes(1000, Msg, [1, 2, 3]).
  523: 
  524: %% Test that apply_repeatedly rejects invalid arguments.
  525: apply_repeatedly_invalid_args(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  526:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_repeatedly(-1, fun() -> ok end),
  527:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_repeatedly(0, foo),
  528:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_repeatedly(0, fun(_X) -> ok end),
  529:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_repeatedly(-1, fun(_X) -> ok end, [foo]),
  530:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_repeatedly(0, foo, []),
  531:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_repeatedly(0, fun(_X) -> ok end, []),
  532:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_repeatedly(0, fun(_X) -> ok end, [foo, bar]),
  533:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_repeatedly(0, fun(_X) -> ok end, foo),
  534:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_repeatedly(-1, foo, bar, []),
  535:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_repeatedly(0, "foo", bar, []),
  536:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_repeatedly(0, foo, "bar", []),
  537:     {error, badarg} = timer:apply_repeatedly(0, foo, bar, baz),
  538:     ok.
  539: 
  540: %% Test of send_interval/2. Receive 5 messages, cancel the timer, and
  541: %% check that we do not get any more messages.
  542: send_interval1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  543:     Msg = make_ref(),
  544:     {ok, Ref} = timer:send_interval(1000, Msg),
  545:     ok = get_mess(1500, Msg, 5),
  546:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  547:     nor = get_mess(1000, Msg). % We should receive only five
  548: 
  549: %% Test of send_interval/3. Receive 2 messages, cancel the timer, and
  550: %% check that we do not get any more messages.
  551: send_interval2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  552:     Msg = make_ref(),
  553:     {ok, Ref} = timer:send_interval(1000, self(), Msg),
  554:     ok = get_mess(1500, Msg, 2),
  555:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  556:     nor = get_mess(1000, Msg).  % We should receive only two
  557: 
  558: %% Test of send_interval/3. Receive 2 messages, cancel the timer, and
  559: %% check that we do not get any more messages. The receiver is the
  560: %% name of a registered process. [OTP-2735]
  561: send_interval3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  562:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  563:     Msg = make_ref(),
  564:     Name = register_name(self()),
  565:     {ok, Ref} = timer:send_interval(1000, Name, Msg),
  566:     ok = get_mess(1500, Msg, 2),
  567:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  568:     nor = get_mess(1000, Msg),  % We should receive only two
  569:     unregister(Name).
  570: 
  571: %% Test of send_interval/3 using a registered name and node.
  572: send_interval4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  573:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  574:     Msg = make_ref(),
  575:     Name = register_name(self()),
  576:     {ok, Ref} = timer:send_interval(1000, {Name, node()}, Msg),
  577:     ok = get_mess(1500, Msg, 2),
  578:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  579:     nor = get_mess(1000, Msg), % We should receive only two
  580:     unregister(Name).
  581: 
  582: %% Test that send interval stops sending msg when the receiving
  583: %% process terminates.
  584: send_interval5(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  585:     Msg1 = make_ref(),
  586:     {ok, {interval, Ref}} = timer:send_interval(500, Msg1),
  587:     receive 
  588:         Msg1 -> ok
  589:     end,
  590:     timer_server ! {'DOWN', Ref, process, self(), test},
  591:     Msg2 = make_ref(),
  592:     {ok, {send_local, _}} = timer:send_after(600, Msg2),
  593:     Msg2 = receive
  594:         TmpMsg -> TmpMsg
  595:     end.
  596: 
  597: %% Test that send_interval rejects invalid arguments.
  598: send_interval_invalid_args(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  599:     {error, badarg} = timer:send_interval(-1, test),
  600:     {error, badarg} = timer:send_interval(-1, self(), test),
  601:     {error, badarg} = timer:send_interval(-1, ?MODULE, test),
  602:     {error, badarg} = timer:send_interval(0, "", test),
  603:     ok.
  604: 
  605: %% Test that we can cancel an instant timer
  606: cancel1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  607:     Msg = make_ref(),
  608:     {ok, Ref} = timer:send_after(0, Msg),
  609:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  610:     ok = get_mess(0, Msg). % We should rec 1 msg as it got sent immediately
  611: 
  612: %% Test that we can cancel a send-once timer.
  613: cancel2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  614:     Msg = make_ref(),
  615:     {ok, Ref} = timer:send_after(1000, Msg),
  616:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  617:     nor = get_mess(2000, Msg). % We should rec 0 msgs
  618: 
  619: %% Test that we can cancel an apply-once timer.
  620: cancel3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  621:     Msg = make_ref(),
  622:     {ok, Ref} = timer:apply_after(1000, erlang, send, [self(), Msg]),
  623:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  624:     nor = get_mess(2000, Msg).
  625: 
  626: %% Test that we can cancel a send-interval timer.
  627: cancel4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  628:     Msg1 = make_ref(),
  629:     {ok, Ref} = timer:send_interval(500, Msg1),
  630:     receive
  631:         Msg1 -> ok
  632:     end,
  633:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  634:     Msg2 = make_ref(),
  635:     {ok, {send_local, _}} = timer:send_after(600, Msg2),
  636:     Msg2 = receive
  637:         TmpMsg -> TmpMsg
  638:     end.
  639: 
  640: %% Test that we can cancel an apply-interval timer.
  641: cancel5(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  642:     Msg1 = make_ref(),
  643:     {ok, Ref} = timer:apply_interval(500, erlang, send, [self(), Msg1]),
  644:     receive
  645:         Msg1 -> ok
  646:     end,
  647:     {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  648:     Msg2 = make_ref(),
  649:     {ok, {send_local, _}} = timer:send_after(600, Msg2),
  650:     Msg2 = receive
  651:         TmpMsg -> TmpMsg
  652:     end.
  653: 
  654: %% Test that cancelling non-existent timers does not crash the
  655: %% timer server. 
  656: cancel6(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  657:     lists:foreach(
  658:         fun (TimerType) ->
  659:             Mon = monitor(process, timer_server),
  660: 	    {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel({TimerType, make_ref()}),
  661:             receive
  662:                 {'DOWN', Mon, process, _, _} ->
  663:                     error({timer_server_crashed, {cancel, TimerType}})
  664:             after 500 ->
  665:                 ok
  666:             end,
  667: 	    demonitor(Mon)
  668:         end,
  669: 	[once, instant, interval, send_local]
  670:     ).
  671: 
  672: %% Test that cancel rejects invalid arguments.
  673: cancel_invalid_args(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  674:     {error, badarg} = timer:cancel(no_reference),
  675:     {error, badarg} = timer:cancel({foo, make_ref()}),
  676:     {error, badarg} = timer:cancel({once, foo}),
  677:     {error, badarg} = timer:cancel({interval, foo}),
  678:     {error, badarg} = timer:cancel({instant, foo}),
  679:     ok.
  680: 
  681: %% Test that sleep pauses the calling process for
  682: %% at least the given time.
  683: sleep1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  684:     T0 = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
  685:     ok = timer:sleep(1000),
  686:     T1 = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
  687:     true = T1 - T0 >= 1000,
  688:     ok.
  689: 
  690: %% Test that sleep accepts times >(2^32)-1, which is
  691: %% the maximum time for the after clause of a receive
  692: %% operation, at the time of this writing.
  693: sleep2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  694:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  695:     Pid = spawn_link(
  696:         fun () ->
  697:             {ok, {once, _}} = timer:kill_after(1000),
  698:             ok = timer:sleep(16#ffffffff+1)
  699:         end
  700:     ),
  701:     ok = get_mess(2000, {'EXIT', Pid, killed}).
  702: 
  703: %% Test that unexpected calls do not crash the timer server.
  704: unexpected1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  705:     Mon = monitor(process, timer_server),
  706:     try
  707:         gen_server:call(timer_server, foo, 100)
  708:     of
  709:         _ ->
  710:             error(timeout_expected)
  711:     catch
  712:         exit:{timeout, _} ->
  713:             ok
  714:     end,
  715:     receive
  716:         {'DOWN', Mon, process, _, _} ->
  717:             error(timer_server_crashed)
  718:     after 500 ->
  719:         ok
  720:     end,
  721:     demonitor(Mon).
  722: 
  723: %% Test that unexpected casts do not crash the timer server.
  724: unexpected2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  725:     Mon = monitor(process, timer_server),
  726:     gen_server:cast(timer_server, foo),
  727:     receive
  728:         {'DOWN', Mon, process, _, _} ->
  729:             error(timer_server_crashed)
  730:     after 500 ->
  731:         ok
  732:     end,
  733:     demonitor(Mon).
  734: 
  735: %% Test that unexpected info messages do not crash the timer server.
  736: unexpected3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  737:     Mon = monitor(process, timer_server),
  738:     timer_server ! foo,
  739:     receive
  740:         {'DOWN', Mon, process, _, _} ->
  741:             error(timer_server_crashed)
  742:     after 500 ->
  743:         ok
  744:     end,
  745:     demonitor(Mon).
  746: 
  747: %% Test that timeouts of one-shot timers the timer server does not
  748: %% know are not executed.
  749: nonexistent1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  750:     Msg = make_ref(),
  751:     timer_server ! {timeout, make_ref(), {apply_once, {erlang, send, [self(), Msg]}}},
  752:     nor = get_mess(1000, Msg).
  753: 
  754: %% Test that timeouts of interval timers the timer server does not
  755: %% know are not executed.
  756: nonexistent2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  757:     Msg = make_ref(),
  758:     timer_server ! {timeout, make_ref, {apply_interval, erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond), 1000, make_ref(), {erlang, send, [self(), Msg]}}},
  759:     nor = get_mess(1000, Msg).
  760: 
  761: %% Test sleep/1 and tc/3.
  762: tc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  763:     %% This should test both sleep and tc/3
  764:     {Res1, ok} = timer:tc(timer, sleep, [500]),
  765:     ok = if
  766:              Res1 < 500*1000 -> {too_early, Res1}; % Too early
  767:              Res1 > 800*1000 -> {too_late, Res1};  % Too much time
  768:              true -> ok
  769:          end,
  770: 
  771:     %% tc/2
  772:     {Res2, ok} = timer:tc(fun(T) -> ok = timer:sleep(T) end, [500]),
  773:     ok = if
  774:              Res2 < 500*1000 -> {too_early, Res2}; % Too early
  775:              Res2 > 800*1000 -> {too_late, Res2};  % Too much time
  776:              true -> ok
  777:          end,
  778: 
  779:     %% tc/1
  780:     {Res3, ok} = timer:tc(fun() -> ok = timer:sleep(500) end),
  781:     ok = if
  782:              Res3 < 500*1000 -> {too_early, Res3}; % Too early
  783:              Res3 > 800*1000 -> {too_late, Res3};  % Too much time
  784:              true -> ok
  785:          end,
  786: 
  787:     %% tc/4
  788:     {Res4, ok} = timer:tc(timer, sleep, [500], millisecond),
  789:     ok = if
  790:              Res4 < 500 -> {too_early, Res4};
  791:              Res4 > 800 -> {too_late, Res4};
  792:              true -> ok
  793:          end,
  794: 
  795:     %% Check that timer:tc don't catch errors
  796:     ok = try timer:tc(erlang, exit, [foo], second)
  797:          catch exit:foo -> ok
  798:          end,
  799: 
  800:     ok = try timer:tc(erlang, exit, [foo])
  801:          catch exit:foo -> ok
  802:          end,
  803: 
  804:     ok = try timer:tc(fun(Reason) -> 1 = Reason end, [foo])
  805:          catch error:{badmatch,_} -> ok
  806:          end,
  807: 
  808:     ok = try timer:tc(fun() -> throw(foo) end)
  809:          catch foo -> ok
  810:          end,
  811: 
  812:     %% Check that return values are propageted
  813:     Self = self(),
  814:     {_, Self} = timer:tc(erlang, self, [], second),
  815:     {_, Self} = timer:tc(erlang, self, []),
  816:     {_, Self} = timer:tc(fun(P) -> P end, [self()]),
  817:     {_, Self} = timer:tc(fun() -> self() end),
  818: 
  819:     Sec = timer:seconds(4),
  820:     Min = timer:minutes(4),
  821:     Hour = timer:hours(4),
  822:     MyRes = 4*1000 + 4*60*1000 + 4*60*60*1000,
  823:     if  MyRes == Sec + Min + Hour -> ok end,
  824:     TimerRes = timer:hms(4,4,4),
  825:     if MyRes == TimerRes -> ok end,
  826:     ok.
  827: 
  828: get_mess(Time, Mess) -> get_mess(Time, Mess, 1).
  829: get_mess(_, _, 0) -> ok;  % Received
  830: get_mess(Time, Mess, N) ->
  831:     receive 
  832:         Mess -> get_mess(Time, Mess, N-1)
  833:     after Time ->
  834:         nor   % Not Received
  835:     end.
  836: 
  837: get_messes(Time, Mess, Indexes) -> get_messes(Time, Mess, Indexes, 1).
  838: get_messes(Time, Mess, Indexes, N) -> get_messes1(Time, Mess, lists:append(lists:duplicate(N, Indexes))).
  839: get_messes1(_, _, []) -> ok;
  840: get_messes1(Time, Mess, Indexes) ->
  841:     receive
  842:         {Mess, Index} -> get_messes1(Time, Mess, lists:delete(Index, Indexes))
  843:     after Time ->
  844:         nor
  845:     end.
  846: 
  847: forever() ->
  848:     ok = timer:sleep(1000),
  849:     forever().
  850: 
  851: 
  852: %%
  853: %% Testing for performance (on different implementations) of timers
  854: %%
  855: 
  856: 
  857: timer_perf(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  858:     performance(timer).
  859: 
  860: performance(Mod) ->
  861:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),    
  862:     {Y,Mo,D} = date(),
  863:     {H,M,S} = time(),
  864:     io:format("Testing module '~p' Date: ~w/~w/~w ~w:~w:~w~n", 
  865:               [Mod,Y,Mo,D,H,M,S]),
  866:     Result = big_test(Mod),
  867:     report_result(Result).
  868: 
  869: big_test(M) ->
  870:     Load_Pids = start_nrev(20, M),   % Increase if more load wanted :)
  871: 
  872:     LPids = spawn_timers(5, M, 10000, 5),
  873: 
  874:     apply(M, sleep, [4000]),
  875:     MPids = spawn_timers(10, M, 1000, 6),
  876: 
  877:     apply(M, sleep, [3500]),
  878:     SPids = spawn_timers(15, M, 100, 3),
  879: 
  880:     Res = wait(SPids ++ MPids ++ LPids, [], 0, M),
  881: 
  882:     lists:foreach(fun(Pid) -> exit(Pid, kill) end, Load_Pids),
  883:     Res.
  884: 
  885: wait([], Res, N, _) ->
  886:     {Res, N};
  887: wait(Pids, ResList, N, M) ->
  888:     receive
  889:         {Pid, ok, Res, T} ->
  890:             wait(lists:delete(Pid, Pids), [{T, Res} | ResList], N, M);
  891:         {Pid, Error}->
  892:             ct:fail(Error),
  893:             wait(lists:delete(Pid, Pids), ResList, N+1, M);
  894:         {'EXIT', Pid, normal} ->
  895:             wait(lists:delete(Pid, Pids), ResList, N, M);
  896:         {'EXIT', Pid, Reason} ->
  897:             ct:fail({Pid,Reason})
  898:     end.
  899: 
  900: spawn_timers(0, _, _, _) ->
  901:     [];
  902: spawn_timers(N, M, T, NumIter) ->
  903:     apply(M, sleep, [120*N]),
  904:     Pid1 = spawn_link(?MODULE, timer, [apply, M, T, self()]),
  905:     Pid2 = spawn_link(?MODULE, timer, [interval, M, T, self(), NumIter]),
  906:     [Pid1, Pid2 | spawn_timers(N-1, M, T, NumIter)].
  907: 
  908: timer(apply, Mod, T, Pid) ->
  909:     Before = system_time(),
  910:     {ok, Ref} = apply(Mod, apply_after, [T, ?MODULE, send, [self(), done]]),
  911:     receive 
  912:         done ->
  913:             After = system_time(),
  914:             Pid ! {self(), ok, (After-Before) div 1000, T}
  915:     after T*3 + 300 ->   % Watch dog
  916:             io:format("WARNING TIMER WATCHDOG timed out: ~w ~n", [T]),
  917:             {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  918:             Pid ! {self(), watch_dog_timed_out}
  919:     end.
  920: 
  921: timer(interval, Mod, T, Pid, NumIter) ->
  922:     Before = system_time(),
  923:     {ok, Ref} = apply(Mod, apply_interval, [T, ?MODULE, send, [self(), done]]),
  924:     timer_irec(Before, T, {0, NumIter}, [], {Pid, Mod, Ref}).
  925: 
  926: timer_irec(_Start, T, {N, N}, Res, {Pid, Mod, Ref}) ->
  927:     apply(Mod, cancel, [Ref]),
  928:     Min = lists:min(Res),
  929:     Max = lists:max(Res),
  930:     Tot = lists:sum(Res),
  931:     Pid ! {self(), ok, {N, Tot, Tot div N, Min, Max}, T};
  932: timer_irec(Start, T, {N, Max}, Res, {Pid, Mod, Ref}) ->
  933:     receive
  934:         done ->
  935:             Now = system_time(),
  936:             Elapsed = (Now - (Start + (N*T*1000))) div 1000,
  937:             timer_irec(Start, T,
  938:                        {N+1, Max},
  939:                        [Elapsed | Res],
  940:                        {Pid, Mod, Ref})
  941:     after T*3 + 300 ->
  942:             apply(Mod, cancel, [Ref]),
  943:             io:format("WARNING: TIMER WATCHDOG timed out <Interval>~w~n",[T]),
  944:             Pid ! {self(), timer_watchdog_timed_out_in_interlval_test}  
  945:     end.
  946: 
  947: %% ------------------------------------------------------- %%
  948: %%  Small last generator
  949: 
  950: start_nrev(0, _) ->
  951:     [];
  952: 
  953: start_nrev(N, M) ->
  954:     Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, do_nrev, [N, M]),
  955:     [Pid | start_nrev(N-1, M)].
  956: 
  957: do_nrev(Sleep, Mod) ->
  958:     apply(Mod, sleep, [50 * Sleep]),
  959:     test(1000,"abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvxyz1234"),
  960:     ok.
  961: 
  962: test(0,_) ->
  963:     true;
  964: test(N,L) ->
  965:     nrev(L),
  966:     test(N - 1, L).
  967: 
  968: nrev([]) ->
  969:     [];
  970: nrev([H|T]) ->
  971:     append(nrev(T), [H]).
  972: 
  973: append([H|T],Z) ->
  974:     [H|append(T,Z)];
  975: append([],X) ->
  976:     X.
  977: 
  978: system_time() ->    
  979:     erlang:monotonic_time(microsecond).
  980: 
  981: %% ------------------------------------------------------- %%
  982: 
  983: report_result({Res, 0}) ->
  984:     {A_List, I_List} = split_list(Res, [], []),
  985:     A_val = calc_a_val(A_List),
  986:     I_val = calc_i_val(I_List),
  987:     print_report(A_val, I_val),
  988:     ok;
  989: 
  990: report_result({Head, N}) ->
  991:     io:format("Test Failed: Number of internal tmo ~w~n", [N]),
  992:     ct:fail({Head, N}).
  993: 
  994: split_list([], AL, IL) ->
  995:     {AL, IL};
  996: split_list([{T, {N, Tot, A, Min, Max}} | Rest], AL, IL) ->
  997:     split_list(Rest, AL, [{T, {N, Tot, A, Min, Max}} | IL]);
  998: split_list([Head | Rest], AL, IL) ->
  999:     split_list(Rest, [Head | AL], IL).
 1000: 
 1001: split([{T, Res} | R]) ->
 1002:     split(R, {{T,[Res]}, {T*10,[]}, {T*100,[]}}).
 1003: 
 1004: split([{T, Res} | R], {{T,S}, M, L}) ->
 1005:     split(R, {{T,[Res|S]}, M, L});
 1006: 
 1007: split([{T, Res} | R], {S, {T,M}, L}) ->
 1008:     split(R, {S, {T, [Res|M]}, L});
 1009: 
 1010: split([{T, Res} | R], {S, M, {T,L}}) ->
 1011:     split(R, {S, M, {T, [Res|L]}});
 1012: 
 1013: split(_Done, Vals) ->
 1014:     Vals.
 1015: 
 1016: calc_a_val(List) ->
 1017:     New = lists:sort(List),
 1018:     {{T1, S}, {T2, M}, {T3, L}} = split(New),
 1019:     S2 = {length(S), lists:max(S), lists:min(S), 
 1020:           lists:sum(S) div length(S)},
 1021:     M2 = {length(M), lists:max(M), lists:min(M), 
 1022:           lists:sum(M) div length(M)},
 1023:     L2 = {length(L), lists:max(L), lists:min(L), 
 1024:           lists:sum(L) div length(L)},
 1025:     [{T1, S2}, {T2, M2}, {T3, L2}].
 1026: 
 1027: calc_i_val(List) ->
 1028:     New =  lists:sort(List),
 1029:     {{T1, S}, {T2, M}, {T3, L}} = split(New),
 1030:     S2 = get_ivals(S),
 1031:     M2 = get_ivals(M),
 1032:     L2 = get_ivals(L),
 1033:     [{T1, S2}, {T2, M2}, {T3, L2}].
 1034: 
 1035: get_ivals(List) ->
 1036:     Len = length(List),
 1037:     Num = element(1, hd(List)), % Number of iterations
 1038: 
 1039:     LTot = lists:map(fun(X) -> element(2, X) end, List),
 1040:     LMin = lists:map(fun(X) -> element(4, X) end, List),
 1041:     LMax = lists:map(fun(X) -> element(5, X) end, List),
 1042: 
 1043:     MaxTot  = lists:max(LTot),
 1044:     MinTot  = lists:min(LTot),
 1045:     AverTot = lists:sum(LTot) div Len,
 1046: 
 1047:     IterMax = lists:max(LMax),
 1048:     IterMin = lists:min(LMin),
 1049:     IterAver= AverTot div Num,
 1050: 
 1051:     {Len, Num,
 1052:      {MaxTot, MinTot, AverTot}, 
 1053:      {IterMax, IterMin, IterAver}}.
 1054: 
 1055: 
 1056: print_report(A_L, I_L) ->
 1057:     io:format("~nRESULTS from timer test~n~n",[]),
 1058:     io:format("Time out times for send_after~n~n", []),
 1059:     io:format("Time No of tests  Max    Min  Average~n",[]),
 1060:     print_aval(A_L),
 1061:     io:format("Time out times for send_interval~n~n", []),
 1062:     io:format("Time No.tests  No.intvals TotMax TotMin TotAver  MaxI   MinI  AverI~n", []),
 1063:     print_ival(I_L).
 1064: 
 1065: print_aval([]) ->
 1066:     io:format("~n~n", []);
 1067: print_aval([{T, {L, Max, Min, Aver}}|R]) ->
 1068:     io:format("~5w ~8w ~6w ~6w ~8w ~n", 
 1069:               [T,L,Max,Min,Aver]),
 1070:     print_aval(R).
 1071: 
 1072: print_ival([]) ->
 1073:     io:format("~n", []);
 1074: print_ival([{T, {Len, Num, 
 1075:                  {MaxT, MinT, AverT},
 1076:                  {MaxI, MinI, AverI}}}|R]) ->
 1077:     io:format("~5w ~6w ~10w ~8w ~6w ~6w ~6w ~6w ~6w~n", 
 1078:               [T,Len,Num,MaxT,MinT,AverT, MaxI, MinI, AverI]),
 1079:     print_ival(R).
 1080: 
 1081: send(Pid, Msg) ->
 1082:     Pid ! Msg.
 1083: 
 1084: %% Create a unique name and register it to the given process.
 1085: register_name(Pid) ->
 1086:     Name = make_name(),
 1087:     register(Name, Pid),
 1088:     Name.
 1089: 
 1090: %% Create a unique name.
 1091: make_name() ->
 1092:     list_to_atom(ref_to_list(make_ref())).
